data.title: What channel is Panthers vs. Falcons on today? Time, TV schedule for NFL Week 1 game
data.meta_description: It's an all-NFC South clash on Sunday down in Atlanta. Here's how to watch Panthers vs. Falcons in Week 1.
data.text:
The NFC South is wide open heading into 2023, and two young QBs in the division get the chance to go at it in Week 1.

Bryce Young is set to make his NFL debut Sunday when this year's No. 1 overall draft pick and the Panthers travel to Atlanta to face off against Desmond Ridder and the Falcons.

MORE: Full NFL coverage map for Week 1 broadcasts

The Matt Rhule era in Carolina ended earlier than expected, as the head coach was fired just five games into his second season after the Panthers began last year 1-4. Interim head coach Steve Wilks helped improve the team, as Carolina went 6-6 down the stretch to finish 7-10.

After failing to make the postseason and still in search of a franchise QB, the Panthers made the bold decision to trade up for the No. 1 pick at the draft, landing Young. With the talented QB out of Alabama at the helm, it's a new look on offense for Carolina, which brought in running back Miles Sanders and wide receivers D.J. Chark Jr. and Adam Thielen while saying goodbye to wide receiver D.J. Moore.

For Atlanta, this marks the first season when Ridder, a 2022 draft selection out of Cincinnati, has the starting job to begin the season. The Falcons struggled under Marcus Mariota last season, finishing the year 7-10 with Ridder taking over for the veteran QB by the end of the year.

The biggest talking point with the Falcons entering this season is running back Bijan Robinson, who was selected eighth overall in this year's draft out of Texas. The dynamic running back is expected to be a focal point in the Falcons' offense.

MORE: Watch Panthers vs. Falcons live with Fubo (free trial)

Here's how to watch the Panthers and Falcons square off in NFL Week 1.

What channel is Panthers vs. Falcons on today?

TV channel (national): Fox

TV channel (Charlotte): WJZY

TV channel (Atlanta): WAGA

Live Stream: Fubo | Fox Sports app | DAZN (Canada)

The Panthers vs. Falcons game will broadcast regionally on local Fox affiliates. WJZY (Channel 46) will carry the game in the Charlotte market, while WAGA (Channel 5) will broadcast the contest in the Atlanta area.

On the Fox call will be play-by-play announcer Chris Myers and analyst Robert Smith, alongside sideline reporter Jen Hale.

Those looking to stream the Panthers vs. Falcons game will have a few ways to do it. Fubo carries Fox, CBS, NBC, NFL Network and the ESPN family of networks, so you'll be covered for all of the NFL's 2023 contests with that service. Those with cable subscriptions can also stream the contest using the Fox Sports App.

Meanwhile, viewers in Canada can watch the game live on DAZN, which is the country's exclusive carrier of NFL Game Pass.

Panthers vs. Falcons start time

Date: Sunday, Sept. 10

Kickoff: 1 p.m. ET

The Panthers vs. Falcons game will kick off at 1 p.m. ET on Sunday. The game will be played at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, Ga.
